question: Ic bidde eow (flieman) #### þa Peohtas! — I bid ye, expel the Picts!
explanation: Here 'flieman' is plural so it takes the 'aþ' ending to become 'fliemaþ'

question: (wunian) #### her swa lange swa ge willaþ — Live here as long as ye wish
explanation: Here 'wunian' is plural so it takes the 'aþ' ending to become 'wuniaþ'

question: (hieran) #### hwæt ic secge, freond! — Hear what I say, friend!
explanation: Here 'hieran' is singular so it takes no ending, becoming 'hier'

question: Preostas (hieran) #### min word! — Priests, listen to my words!
explanation: Here 'hieran' is plural so it takes the 'aþ' ending to become 'hieraþ'

question: Þu! (don) #### swa ic bidde! — You! Do as I ask!
explanation: Here 'don' is singular so it takes no ending, becoming 'do'

question: Leode, (don) #### swa we biddaþ! — People, do as we ask!
explanation: Here 'don' is plural so it loses the 'n' and gains 'þ' to become 'doþ'

commonMistakes.explanation: Remember, 'don' is an irregular verb so its plural form is 'doþ'

question: Freondas, (gan) #### to eowrum scipum! — Friends, go to your ships!
explanation: Here 'gan' is plural so it loses the 'n' and gains 'þ' to become 'gaþ'

question: Min sunu, (gan) #### to þin bearne! — Son, go to your child!
explanation: Here 'gan' is singular so it takes no ending, becoming 'ga'

question: (gan) #### ond gret þa wealas þe hergiaþ nu in þæm tune — Go and greet the foreigners that plunder now in that town
explanation: Here 'gan' is singular so it takes no ending, becoming 'ga'

question: Þegen! (rædan) #### hiera cyning þæt mina fierda sind micel — Advise their king that my army is large
explanation: Here 'rædan' is singular so it takes no ending, becoming 'ræd'

question: (rædan) #### me, leof abbod — Advise me, beloved abbot!
explanation: Here 'rædan' is singular so it takes no ending, becoming 'ræd'

question: (rædan) #### me, witan — Advise me, counsellors!
explanation: Here 'rædan' is plural so it takes the 'aþ' ending to become 'rædaþ'

question: (læran) #### mec, wis wif — Teach me, wise wife!
explanation: Here 'læran' is singular so it takes no ending, becoming 'lær'

question: (gan) #### þu into þære ceastre! — Go into the city!
explanation: Here 'gan' is singular so it takes no ending, becoming 'ga'

question: Crist cwæð þa to ðam deofle: '(gan) #### ðu underbæc!' — Christ said to the devil: 'Go back down!'
explanation: Here 'gan' is singular so it takes no ending, becoming 'ga'

question: Gif ðu godes sunu sy, (gan) #### of ðære rode — If you are god's son, come off the cross
explanation: Here 'gan' is singular so it takes no ending, becoming 'ga'

question: (habban) #### on muþe swa hat swa þu hatost mæge — Have it in your mouth as hot as you can stand
explanation: Here 'habban' is singular but since the verb is irregular it becomes 'hafa'

commonMistakes.explanation: Remember, 'habban' is an irregular verb and its singular form is 'hafa'

question: Garmund, godes ðegen, find þæt feoh and fere þæt feoh and (habban) #### þæt feoh and heald þæt feoh — Garmund, God's retainer, find that wealth and move that wealth and have that wealth and hold that wealth!
explanation: Here 'habban' is singular but since the verb is irregular it becomes 'hafa'

commonMistakes.explanation: Remember, 'habban' is an irregular verb and its singular form is 'hafa'

question: He cwæþ: (gan) #### on þa wic þe beforan inc stondeð — He said: Go into the camp that we two are standing before
explanation: Here 'gan' is plural so it gains 'þ' to become 'gaþ'

question: (drincan) #### þu þis, þæt þu me berest to drincane — Drink this, that you bring me to drink
explanation: Here 'drincan' is singular so it takes no ending, becoming 'drinc'

question: (etan) #### wyrta eowre grene! — Eat your vegetables raw!
explanation: Here 'etan' is plural so it gains 'aþ' to become 'etaþ'

question: Wið heafodwærc (niman) #### hamwyrt niþewearde gecnuwa lege on ceald wæter gnid swiðe oþ þæt eall geleþred sie ond beþe mid þæt heafod — For a headache, take the lower part of houseleek, mix it, lay it in cold water, grind well until it is all lathered, and bathe the head with that
explanation: Here 'niman' is singular so it takes no ending, becoming 'nim'

question: Ne (beon) #### ge to forhte — Be ye not afraid!
explanation: Here 'beon' is plural so it loses the 'n' and gains 'þ' to become 'beoþ'

commonMistakes.explanation: Remember, 'beon' is an irregular verb and its plural form is 'beoþ'

question: (cuman) #### to ðam lande, ðe ic ðe geswutelige — Come to the land which I will show you
explanation: Here 'cuman' is singular so it takes no ending, becoming 'cum'

question: (secgan) #### me hwær scyne seo sunne on niht, cnapa! — Tell me where the sun shines at night, boy!
explanation: Here 'secgan' is singular but since the verb is irregular it becomes 'secge'

commonMistakes.explanation: Remember, 'secgan' is an irregular verb and its singular form is 'secge'

question: Þa wuduwan ond þa stiopcild ne (sceððan) #### ge — Do not injure the widow and the stepchild
explanation: Here 'sceððan' is plural so it gains 'aþ' to become 'sceððað'

question: Nu (helpan) #### þu me, leofa Drihten
explanation: Here 'helpan' is singular so it takes no ending, becoming 'help'
